Articles.Content: I've been really excited to try out 1.2 but whenever I try to get it off of Steam from the beta pre-release, I can't access it. I have signed up for beta on the settings and also singed up for the pre release discussion or group or whatever its called. Am I still missing something?

I've been really excited to try out 1.2 but whenever I try to get it off of Steam from the beta pre-release, I can't access it. I have signed up for beta on the settings and also singed up for the pre release discussion or group or whatever its called. Am I still missing something?

44 minutes ago, ty.schoenecker said:

I've been really excited to try out 1.2 but whenever I try to get it off of Steam from the beta pre-release, I can't access it. I have signed up for beta on the settings and also singed up for the pre release discussion or group or whatever its called. Am I still missing something? 

Does your Steam apps list look like this for KSP?

Kerbal Space Program [prerelease]

Or does it say ANYTHING else?

If it says exactly the above, then you should have the prerelease installed. I can't even think of what to do otherwise. Uninstall and reinstall seems drastic but hey. Also verify game cache and maybe check Library -> Downloads to see if the download is queued for the future. If so, there's a "download now" button on the right side.

1 hour ago, 5thHorseman said:

Does your Steam apps list look like this for KSP?

Kerbal Space Program [prerelease]

Or does it say ANYTHING else?

Also verify game cache and maybe check Library -> Downloads to see if the download is queued for the future. If so, there's a "download now" button on the right side.

Hey, I tried what you recommended and reinstalling it worked! Thanks a bunch for that but real quick, would 1.1 plugins like hyper edit or vessel mover still work in 1.2?
There is a hyperedit version out for 1.2 prerelease already at kerbaltek.com
